paragraphs.content: Chapter 10
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 10

paragraphs.content: Hear ye the word which the LORD speaketh unto you, O house of Israel:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hear ye the word which the Lord speaketh unto you, O house of Israel:

paragraphs.content: Thus saith the LORD, Learn not the way of the heathen, and be not dismayed at the signs of heaven; for the heathen are dismayed at them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thus saith the Lord, Learn not the way of the heathen, and be not dismayed at the signs of heaven; for the heathen are dismayed at them.

paragraphs.content: For the customs of the people are vain: for one cutteth a tree out of the forest, the work of the hands of the workman, with the axe.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the customs of the people are vain: for one cutteth a tree out of the forest, the work of the hands of the workman, with the axe.

paragraphs.content: They deck it with silver and with gold; they fasten it with nails and with hammers, that it move not.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They deck it with silver and with gold; they fasten it with nails and with hammers, that it move not.

paragraphs.content: They are upright as the palm tree, but speak not: they must needs be borne, because they cannot go. Be not afraid of them; for they cannot do evil, neither also is it in them to do good.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They are upright as the palm tree, but speak not: they must needs be borne, because they cannot go. Be not afraid of them; for they cannot do evil, neither also is it in them to do good.

paragraphs.content: Forasmuch as there is none like unto thee, O LORD; thou art great, and thy name is great in might.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Forasmuch as there is none like unto thee, O Lord; thou art great, and thy name is great in might.

paragraphs.content: Who would not fear thee, O King of nations? for to thee doth it appertain: forasmuch as among all the wise men of the nations, and in all their kingdoms, there is none like unto thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who would not fear thee, O King of nations? for to thee doth it appertain: forasmuch as among all the wise men of the nations, and in all their kingdoms, there is none like unto thee.

paragraphs.content: But they are altogether brutish and foolish: the stock is a doctrine of vanities.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But they are altogether brutish and foolish: the stock is a doctrine of vanities.

paragraphs.content: Silver spread into plates is brought from Tarshish, and gold from Uphaz, the work of the workman, and of the hands of the founder: blue and purple is their clothing: they are all the work of cunning men.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Silver spread into plates is brought from Tarshish, and gold from Uphaz, the work of the workman, and of the hands of the founder: blue and purple is their clothing: they are all the work of cunning men.

paragraphs.content: But the LORD is the true God, he is the living God, and an everlasting king: at his wrath the earth shall tremble, and the nations shall not be able to abide his indignation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But the Lord is the true God, he is the living God, and an everlasting king: at his wrath the earth shall tremble, and the nations shall not be able to abide his indignation.

paragraphs.content: Thus shall ye say unto them, The gods that have not made the heavens and the earth, even they shall perish from the earth, and from under these heavens.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thus shall ye say unto them, The gods that have not made the heavens and the earth, even they shall perish from the earth, and from under these heavens.

paragraphs.content: He hath made the earth by his power, he hath established the world by his wisdom, and hath stretched out the heavens by his discretion.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He hath made the earth by his power, he hath established the world by his wisdom, and hath stretched out the heavens by his discretion.

paragraphs.content: When he uttereth his voice, there is a multitude of waters in the heavens, and he causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth; he maketh lightnings with rain, and bringeth forth the wind out of his treasures.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When he uttereth his voice, there is a multitude of waters in the heavens, and he causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth; he maketh lightnings with rain, and bringeth forth the wind out of his treasures.

paragraphs.content: Every man is brutish in his knowledge: every founder is confounded by the graven image: for his molten image is falsehood, and there is no breath in them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Every man is brutish in his knowledge: every founder is confounded by the graven image: for his molten image is falsehood, and there is no breath in them.

paragraphs.content: They are vanity, and the work of errors: in the time of their visitation they shall perish.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They are vanity, and the work of errors: in the time of their visitation they shall perish.

paragraphs.content: The portion of Jacob is not like them: for he is the former of all things; and Israel is the rod of his inheritance: The LORD of hosts is his name.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The portion of Jacob is not like them: for he is the former of all things; and Israel is the rod of his inheritance: The Lord of hosts is his name.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Gather up thy wares out of the land, O inhabitant of the fortress.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Gather up thy wares out of the land, O inhabitant of the fortress.

paragraphs.content: For thus saith the LORD, Behold, I will sling out the inhabitants of the land at this once, and will distress them, that they may find it so.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thus saith the Lord, Behold, I will sling out the inhabitants of the land at this once, and will distress them, that they may find it so.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Woe is me for my hurt! my wound is grievous: but I said, Truly this is a grief, and I must bear it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Woe is me for my hurt! my wound is grievous: but I said, Truly this is a grief, and I must bear it.

paragraphs.content: My tabernacle is spoiled, and all my cords are broken: my children are gone forth of me, and they are not: there is none to stretch forth my tent any more, and to set up my curtains.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My tabernacle is spoiled, and all my cords are broken: my children are gone forth of me, and they are not: there is none to stretch forth my tent any more, and to set up my curtains.

paragraphs.content: For the pastors are become brutish, and have not sought the LORD: therefore they shall not prosper, and all their flocks shall be scattered.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the pastors are become brutish, and have not sought the Lord: therefore they shall not prosper, and all their flocks shall be scattered.

paragraphs.content: Behold, the noise of the bruit is come, and a great commotion out of the north country, to make the cities of Judah desolate, and a den of dragons.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, the noise of the bruit is come, and a great commotion out of the north country, to make the cities of Judah desolate, and a den of dragons.

paragraphs.content: ¶ O LORD, I know that the way of man is not in himself: it is not in man that walketh to direct his steps.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ O Lord, I know that the way of man is not in himself: it is not in man that walketh to direct his steps.

paragraphs.content: O LORD, correct me, but with judgment; not in thine anger, lest thou bring me to nothing.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O Lord, correct me, but with judgment; not in thine anger, lest thou bring me to nothing.

paragraphs.content: Pour out thy fury upon the heathen that know thee not, and upon the families that call not on thy name: for they have eaten up Jacob, and devoured him, and consumed him, and have made his habitation desolate.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Pour out thy fury upon the heathen that know thee not, and upon the families that call not on thy name: for they have eaten up Jacob, and devoured him, and consumed him, and have made his habitation desolate.
